business.headline: PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on the one skill AI can't replaceNithin Kamath explained that curiosity should not be confined to a person's own role but should extend to the larger environment around them.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Common empanelment explained: Why big private hospitals and insurers are at oddsCommon empanelment aims to simplify cashless insurance in India, but hospitals resist over tariffs and operational issues, leaving policyholders' access dependent on achieving fair rates, efficient settlements, and system flexibility.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again after delayed rollout of utilities?With the revised ITR utilities coming out much later than expected, taxpayers and professionals are now questioning whether the government will grant another extension to ease the compliance burden.

Mangal Electrical IPO allotment out: Check your status, possible listing gainsInvestors who applied for the Mangal Electrical IPO can check their allotment status through two official platforms, the BSE website and the IPO registrar, Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Online Gaming Bill: Will users get Dream11, MPL, Winzo wallet cash?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro rally: Why are IT stocks rising today?Analysts said the rally reflects expectations that lower US interest rates will make emerging markets, including India, more attractive to foreign investors, supporting inflows into the sector.
Sensex rises over 200 points, Nifty above 24,900; IT stocks lead gainsAt 9:22 am, the BSE Sensex rose 203.14 points to 81,509.99, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 53.20 points to 24,923.30.

New GST rates likely by Dussehra, government braces for big revenue shortfallThe proposed GST revamp aims to simplify the tax system by introducing a two-tier rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% levy on sin goods. While the move promises greater simplicity, it is expected to significantly impact revenues for both central and state governments.

How new Income Tax Bill 2025 brings relief for salaried and small taxpayersEndless forms and confusing jargon may soon be history. The New Income Tax Bill 2025 could be the game-changer salaried and small taxpayers have been waiting for.

entertainment.headline: Leadergiri mat kar: Called out on day one, but who is Mridul Tiwari in BB 19?'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Mridul Tiwari commands a massive online following, with 4.5 million followers on Instagram and over 19 million subscribers on YouTube.

Aavesham track used in Netflix's Splinter Cell, composer questions lack of credit'Aavesham' composer Sushin Shyam questioned the omission of credit in the Netflix trailer of 'Splinter Cell: Deathwatch'.  Netflix is yet to respond to him.

Mistaken for Armaan and Ranveer Singh, Amaal Mallik seeks identity on Bigg Boss 19Music composer Amaal Mallik entered 'Bigg Boss 19' and spoke about his struggles with identity, often being mistaken for other Bollywood stars. He also shared that he wants people to know him for his music and is ready to face the challenges of the show.

Ufff Yeh Siyapaa trailer: Sohum Shah, Nora, Nushrratt tease silent dark comedyThe trailer for Ufff Yeh Siyapaa, a dialogue-free dark comedy, was released on August 25, 2025. It depicts a chaotic crime story filled with humour and unexpected twists.

Neha Dhupia says she was judged for pregnancy, like Alia Bhatt and Neena GuptaNeha Dhupia says she's joined Alia Bhatt and Neena Gupta on the list of women who were judged for their pregnancy. The actor was speaking about building supportive communities for women where they can speak freely about their health and life choices.

Aneet Padda singing Saiyaara with her father wins hearts. Watch viral videoA video of actor Aneet Padda singing an unplugged version of the 'Saiyaara' title track with her father is going viral on social media. Many users have praised her singing talent in the comments section of the Instagram post.

Yash begins gruelling 45-day shoot with John Wick action director JJ Perry for ToxicJJ Perry, action director known for 'John Wick' and 'Fast & Furious', collaborates with an Indian stunt crew for the film 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-ups'. The film features Yash in the lead.

Comedian Pranit More's old Salman Khan jokes go viral after Bigg Boss 19 entryPranit More, a Bigg Boss 19 contestant, is trending for his old jokes about Salman Khan. These clips have sparked widespread social media reactions highlighting the irony of his presence on the Salman-hosted show.

Madharaasi trailer: Sivakarthikeyan leads intense thriller on smuggling weaponsSivakarthikeyan's much-awaited trailer of his upcoming film, 'Madharaasi' was unveiled on Sunday. The two-minute-17-second-long trailer gives a glimpse of the action-packed story of AR Murugadoss-directorial.

Varun Dhawan, Janhvi Kapoor serve festive revenge in Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi KumariVarun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor bring the colours of romance and the brightness of festivities together in the new promo for 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'. The film is directed by Shashank Khaitan and is coming out on Dussehra.

When Raghav Chadha-Parineeti Chopra hinted at pregnancy way before the announcementBefore actor Parineeti Chopra and politician Raghav Chaddha's pregnancy announcement on Instagram, the couple had already dropped a cheeky hint on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'. Here's what had happened.

Sohail Khan shares parents Salim-Salma's dinner moment, Salman Khan says ek numberA heartwarming video of veteran screenwriter Salim Khan tenderly feeding his wife Salma has touched many hearts online. The clip, shared by their son Sohail Khan, has garnered widespread admiration from fans and Bollywood celebrities alike.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha announce pregnancy: Blessed beyond measureParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha are going to welcome their first child soon. The couple announced the news on social media.

Diana Penty, Tamannaah Bhatia's Do You Wanna Partner to stream from September 12Actors Denty Penty and Tamannaah Bhatia have teamed up for a new series titled 'Do You Wanna Partner'. The series will premiere on September 12 and explore female entrepreneurship.

Inspector Zende trailer: Manoj Bajpayee leads manhunt for Charles SobhrajNetflix released the much-anticipated trailer for 'Inspector Zende', a film inspired by true events. The film follows Inspector Madhukar Zende's (played by Manoj Bajpayee) relentless pursuit of the 'Swimsuit Killer'.

​​​​​​​Vivek Agnihotri advises John Abraham to focus on bikes and protein, not filmsFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri said in an interview that he wouldn't care for John Abraham's statement against him or his films because the actor is not a historian or an intellectual. 'The Bengal Files' director further asked Abraham to stick to building body and stay away from cinema.

Actor Daisy Shah calls out Kannada cinema's obsession with close-up navel shotsActor Daisy Shah, in a recent interview, revealed that Kannada film industry is obsessed with close-up navel shots of female actors.  She recalled seeing a particular actor having such scenes in all his films.

Aishwarya Rai nearly exited Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai. Anil Kapoor reveals whyAnil Kapoor celebrated 25 years of 'Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai' by recalling how Aishwarya Rai joined the film after initial doubts and last-minute hesitation. The 2000 Satish Kaushik-directorial became a box office hit, loved for its emotional story and the lead pair's chemistry.

K3G's young Kareena Kapoor Malvika Raaj and husband become parents to baby girlActor Malvika Raaj, known for her role as young Poo in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', has a new addition to her family. She and her husband, Pranav Bagga, announced the birth of their daughter via Instagram on Sunday.

general news.headline: Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Israeli strike on Gaza hospital kills at least 15, including journalistsThe attack came after Israel's military announced the first steps of an operation to take over Gaza City last week and called up tens of thousands of reservists while the Benjamin Netanyahu government considered a new ceasefire proposal to pause nearly two years of war.

When women die, we scroll: India's outrage gap on gendered violenceViolence against women is not accidental or spontaneous; it is structural, patterned, and legitimised through custom, silence, and legal delay. It is no longer perceived as a rupture but as routine, an unending cycle that reveals a society deeply invested in disciplining, diminishing, and discarding women.

Like Hitler celebrating Jews: BJP slams Kerala's invite to Stalin for Ayyappa eventThe BJP launched a blistering attack on the Kerala government for inviting Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin to the Global Ayyappa Sangamam, calling it hypocrisy and likening it to "Hitler celebrating Jews."

Gurugram fails 40-mm test. Where do Indian cities stand on Doobo-meter?Overnight rain drowned Mumbai with schools cancelled and residents asked to stay indoors. Days earlier, it was Millennium City Gurugram where residents were left stranded. Same for Delhi, Bengaluru and Chennai. Here's a Doobo-meter to reveal how much rain it takes to submerge our cities, and which one drowns the fastest.

Apologise to persons with disabilities: Supreme Court warns comedians of finesThe top court also asked influencers to file an affidavit detailing the steps they can take to use their platforms to raise awareness about the rights of persons with disabilities.

Will US deport Green Card, visa holders using old drunk-driving cases?A new US bill could make a single drink and drive case, even from years ago, the grounds for deportation or entry denial for Green Card and visa holders. Immigrant communities and experts fear it could bypass due process and disproportionately affect legal residents. The bill could affect lakhs of Indians working or studying in the US.

3 defeats changed Rahul Gandhi's moral stance: Amit Shah amid criminal netas billAmit Shah drew a sharp contrast between Rahul Gandhi's past and present positions, recalling the 2013 incident when Rahul Gandhi had publicly rejected and torn an ordinance introduced by then PM Manmohan Singh's cabinet.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha announce pregnancy: Blessed beyond measureParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha are going to welcome their first child soon. The couple announced the news on social media.

ED raids Trinamool MLA's home, he scales wall and tries to flee; arrestedTrinamool MLA, upon learning of the raid, reportedly tried to flee by scaling the boundary wall of his house but was apprehended by ED officers in a nearby agricultural field, covered in mud.

BCCI to end association with sponsor Dream11 after ban on online money gamesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and fantasy sports platform Dream11 to end their sponsorship deals following the passage of the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, which imposes a blanket ban on fantasy and real-money gaming platforms.

Top court pauses FIRs against political analyst on deleted Maharashtra poll tweetDuring today's hearing, Lokniti-CSDS co-director Sanjay Kumar's counsel argued that his client was a "person with impeccable integrity." "30 years of conscientious service to the nation and to the world. He's highly respected. It was a mistake. He apologised. He deleted and apologised publicly," Kumar's counsel said.

Hiring: Doomscrollers. The job nobody saw comingWhat if we told you that being a doomscroller could actually land you a job? Yes, companies are now hiring them - and a viral LinkedIn post by a Mumbai-based entrepreneur scouting for doomscrollers is proof.
Why there is a growing call to tax spare bedrooms in AustraliaA proposal to tax spare bedrooms in Australia aims to address the housing supply and affordability crisis, sparking debate among experts.

Writer Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara, expelled BJP MLA questions faithBooker Prize-winning Kannada writer Banu Mushtaq will inaugurate the Mysuru Dasara Mahotsava on September 22, 2025. Expelled BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal objected, questioning her participation in the religious ceremony.

Top court pauses case against Ashoka University professor over Op Sindoor postThe bench, comprising Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi, also granted time to the professor's counsel to respond to the Special Investigation Team (SIT) report submitted in the matter.

Lift-off, drop, splashdown: Inside Isro's Gaganyaan air-drop testThe test was conducted in collaboration with the Indian Air Force (IAF), Indian Navy, Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), and Indian Coast Guard, reflecting a coordinated national effort.

Cheers, pride, and parade: In pics, how Lucknow welcomed astronaut ShuxThe Indian Air Force officer returned to India from the US on August 17 but visited Lucknow following multiple outreach events, including a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on August 18.

Can PM run office from jail?: Amit Shah blasts Opposition over criminal netas billResponding to concerns that the provision could be misused through politically motivated arrests, Shah said that courts would act responsibly and that bail would be granted before the 30-day period in such cases, leaving no scope for misuse.

Online Gaming Bill: Will users get Dream11, MPL, Winzo wallet cash?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

Ahmedabad school stabbing: Why are children turning violent?A Class 10 student was fatally stabbed by a junior during a school fight in Ahmedabad. The incident exposes growing youth aggression and urgent mental health challenges in Indian schools.

Sonia Gandhi's aide says Bangladeshis can live in India, BJP breathes fireSyeda Hameed, a former Planning Commission member under the Manmohan Singh government, who is visiting Assam with other activists, had said that Bangladeshis "are also humans" and should not be deprived of the right to live in India, as "Earth is so large."

Zohran Mamdani struggles to lift barbell, rivals take shots as video goes viralZohran Mamdani participated in the Men's Day festivities on August 23, where onlookers recorded him struggling to lift a 135-pound barbell.

Man kills pregnant wife, CCTV shows him leave home with her body parts in bagsThe incident occurred due to frequent quarrels over family disputes between the 21-year-old victim, who was five-month-old pregnant, and the 27-year-old husband, who has been taken into police custody.

Aavesham track used in Netflix's Splinter Cell, composer questions lack of credit'Aavesham' composer Sushin Shyam questioned the omission of credit in the Netflix trailer of 'Splinter Cell: Deathwatch'.  Netflix is yet to respond to him.

Ufff Yeh Siyapaa trailer: Sohum Shah, Nora, Nushrratt tease silent dark comedyThe trailer for Ufff Yeh Siyapaa, a dialogue-free dark comedy, was released on August 25, 2025. It depicts a chaotic crime story filled with humour and unexpected twists.

The actor was speaking about building supportive communities for women where they can speak freely about their health and life choices.

Watch viral videoA video of actor Aneet Padda singing an unplugged version of the 'Saiyaara' title track with her father is going viral on social media. Many users have praised her singing talent in the comments section of the Instagram post.

sports.headline: Novak Djokovic to hire Monica Seles as coach? Serb legend opens upNovak Djokovic revealed he is exploring a short-term coaching collaboration with childhood idol Monica Seles, describing it as more emotional than long-term. On court, Djokovic overcame Learner Tien in straight sets to reach the US Open second round.

Fantasy Nightmare: BCCI begins hunt for new sponsor after Dream11 walks outDream11 has ended its title sponsorship of the Indian cricket team following the government's ban on real money gaming. The BCCI is now actively searching for a new sponsor but may not finalise one before the upcoming Asia Cup.

Arshdeep Singh got impatient after not getting chance in England: Punjab coachIndia left-arm seamer Arshdeep Singh was left impatient after not getting a chance in the five-match Test series against England, revealed Punjab bowling coach Gagandeep Singh.

Day 2 Order of Play: Carlos Alcaraz, Venus Williams begin campaignsThe U.S. Open's first round continues on Monday, featuring world number two Carlos Alcaraz taking on a challenging opponent in Reilly Opelka. Former champion Venus Williams makes a highly anticipated return to Grand Slam action in the women's draw, while teenage sensation Victoria Mboko is set to make her Flushing Meadows debut.

Badminton World Championships: Livestream details for India matchesThe Badminton World Championships is set to begin on August 25, Monday. Several top Indian stars are set to participate in the tournament. Here's where you can watch the games live.

Medvedev controversy explained: Photographer sparks insane 10 minutes in US OpenUS Open: Daniil Medvedev riled up the crowd at the Louis Armstrong Stadium on Monday, August 25. Defending the match point in the third set against Benjamin Bonzi, Medvedev sparked an insane 10 minute at the US Open, simply with his on-court antics.

Women's World Cup 2025: Uncapped batter Eyman Fatima named in Pakistan's squadPakistan announced their 15-member squad for the Women's World Cup 2025, featuring uncapped ODI batter Eyman Fatima. The Men in Green will begin their campaign against Bangladesh.

BCCI to end association with sponsor Dream11 after ban on online money gamesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and fantasy sports platform Dream11 to end their sponsorship deals following the passage of the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, which imposes a blanket ban on fantasy and real-money gaming platforms.

Shakib Al Hasan becomes first Bangladesh player to reach 500 T20 wicketsVeteran Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan became only the fifth cricketer in history—and the first from his country—to claim 500 wickets in T20 cricket.

Medvedev beats racket to a pulp after emotional rollercoaster vs BonziRussian star Daniil Medvedev shattered his racket after first round exit in the US Open against Benjamin Bonzi. Medvedev went through an emotional rollercoaster against his French opponent on Monday, August 25.

Sanju Samson warms up for Asia Cup with blazing 42-ball century as openerIndia batter Sanju Samson slammed a breathtaking 42-ball century in Match 8 of the Kerala Cricket League. Samson played a breathtaking innings of 121 (51) to help Kochi Blue Tigers chase down 237.

Women's World Cup 2025: Uncapped batter Eyman Fatima named in Pakistan's squadPakistan announced their 15-member squad for the Women's World Cup 2025, featuring uncapped ODI batter Eyman Fatima. The Men in Green will begin their campaign against Bangladesh.

BCCI to end association with sponsor Dream11 after ban on online money gamesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and fantasy sports platform Dream11 to end their sponsorship deals following the passage of the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, which imposes a blanket ban on fantasy and real-money gaming platforms.

Shakib Al Hasan becomes first Bangladesh player to reach 500 T20 wicketsVeteran Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan became only the fifth cricketer in history—and the first from his country—to claim 500 wickets in T20 cricket.

Medvedev beats racket to a pulp after emotional rollercoaster vs BonziRussian star Daniil Medvedev shattered his racket after first round exit in the US Open against Benjamin Bonzi. Medvedev went through an emotional rollercoaster against his French opponent on Monday, August 25.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
